About

I'm a medical student at UCL interested in computational approaches to behavioural neuroscience and psychiatry. I am also personally inclined towards the philosophy and phenomenology of psychopathology â€“ finding continuity between these two paradigms is my primary academic goal.

You can contact me via email at [firstname] at ponnekanti dot net.

Previous Work

  • Training large language models on GAD-7 and PHQ-9 responses in an effort to surface clinically useful latent factors that influence self-report at the Applied Computational Psychiatry Lab
  • Identifying novel congenital cataract-causing variants using the NGS pipeline (paper available here)
  • Developing a synthetic degradation model for retinal fundus images to generate robust pairwise training data for image enhancement networks at Pontikos Lab
  • Analysing the video output of the adaptive optics laser scanning ophthalmoscope at Michaelides Lab

Colophon

This blog is built with Eleventy, a static site generator; I have written about its merits here. It is hosted for free on Cloudflare Pages. The font used is a subset WOFF2 version of EB Garamond. The site also uses an instant.page script to pre-load internal links upon hover.
